text: Liberal Senator James Paterson says its “way out of line” for a Sydney preschool to use children as young as three as their “props for political campaigns”. Kelly’s Place Children’s Centre in Sydney’s north has reportedly used children as young as three to lobby the government to fly the Aboriginal flag on the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Mr Paterson told Sky News “it’s inappropriate and it doesn’t really matter what the content of the political cause is, we need to let three and four-year-old’s enjoy their childhood and not be used as props for political campaigns”. “It’s frankly way out of line”, he said. There has been a failure of judgment here, and I hope that now this has come to light they reflect on the appropriateness of this.”
